oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tandy Rice Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1980 Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Tandy Rice. The recording takes place on 09-19-1980.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tandy Rice
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:14) -- Tandy Rice speaks about his personal automobile, a Datsun 280zx. (3:41) -- Interview resumes, car talk continues. (4:06) -- "I want to get where I'm going without a hassle, and enjoy it, and that's the end of it as far as I'm concerned." - Tandy Rice. (6:00) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about a possible car wreck. (7:16) -- Bob Allen questions Tandy Rice about his cabin in the woods. (9:10) -- Tandy Rice speaks about his personal and family's morning routine. (11:32) -- Tandy Rice speaks about his day ahead - speaking to 60 students from Mississippi St. University. (13:56) -- Tandy Rice speaks about the number of telephone calls he receives at Top Billing in a day. Tandy Rice goes on to describe his "cabin days." (14:53) -- Tandy Rice describes his morning staff report and plan for the day. (17:40) -- Tandy Rice describes his own work ethic. (19:32) -- Tandy Rice describes the importance of his staff at Top Billing. (21:35) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about the financial beginnings of Top Billing. (23:31) -- Tandy Rice speaks about the priorities of Top Billing. (28:35) -- Tandy Rice introduces Ginger Hennessy to Bob Allen. (30:28) -- Bob Allen asks Tandy Rice about his business policies and work ethic of Top Billing.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rice, Tandy;
